meanings.definition: The quality or state of being conical.
meanings.sent1: The conicity of the ice cream cone made it easy to lick from top to bottom.
meanings.sent2: The conicity of the mountain peak made it a challenging climb for the hikers.
meanings.sent3: The conicity of the traffic cone wearing a tiny hat amused the children playing nearby.
meanings.sent4: The conicity of the seashell spiraled like a miniature tornado.
meanings.sent5: The conicity of the birthday hat made it stand out among the other party decorations.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a surface or solid approaches a cone in shape.
meanings.sent1: The conicity of the traffic cone helped direct cars safely around the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The conicity of the volcano's slope indicated its potential for eruption.
meanings.sent3: The conicity of the ice cream cone-shaped cloud in the sky made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: The conicity of the spiral staircase gave the illusion of descending into a vortex.
meanings.sent5: The conicity of the pyramid's tip made it a symbol of ancient architectural precision.
